00024 inline void purify_image_ixiy2ind(int *ind, int ix, int iy, 
00025                                   purify_image *img) {
00026 
00027  if (ix >= img->nx || ix >= img->ny)
00028     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Image index too large");
00029 
00030   *ind = ix * img->ny + iy;
00031 
00032 }
00033 
00034 
00045 inline void purify_image_ind2iuiv(int *ix, int *iy, int ind, 
00046                                   purify_image *img) {
00047 
00048   if (ind >= img->nx*img->ny)
00049     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Image index too large");
00050 
00051   *ix = ind / img->ny; // Integer division.
00052   *iy = ind - *ix * img->ny;
00053 
00054 }

00064 void purify_image_free(purify_image *img) {
00065   
00066   if(img->pix != NULL) free(img->pix);
00067   img->fov_x = 0.0;
00068   img->fov_y = 0.0;
00069   img->nx = 0;
00070   img->ny = 0;
00071 
00072 }

00087 int purify_image_compare(purify_image *img1, 
00088                          purify_image *img2, 
00089                          double tol) {
00090 
00091   int i;
00092 
00093   if (fabs(img1->fov_x - img2->fov_x) > tol) return 1;
00094   if (fabs(img1->fov_y - img2->fov_y) > tol) return 1;
00095   if (img1->nx != img2->nx) return 1;
00096   if (img1->ny != img2->ny) return 1;
00097   for (i = 0; i < img1->nx*img1->ny; i++) 
00098     if (fabs(img1->pix[i] - img2->pix[i]) > tol) return 1;
00099 
00100   return 0;
00101 }

00117 int purify_image_readfile(purify_image *img,
00118                           const char *filename,
00119                           purify_image_filetype filetype) {
00120 
00121   char buffer[PURIFY_STRLEN];
00122   fitsfile *fptr;
00123   int fits_status = 0;
00124   int hdutype;
00125   int naxis, bitpix, anynul;
00126   long naxes[4], fpixel[4];
00127 
00128   switch (filetype) {
00129   case PURIFY_IMAGE_FILETYPE_FITS:
00130 
00131     // Open fits file.
00132     fits_open_file(&fptr, filename, READONLY, &fits_status);
00133     fits_report_error(stdout, fits_status);
00134 
00135     // Move to first header.
00136     fits_movabs_hdu(fptr, 1, &hdutype, &fits_status);
00137     fits_report_error(stdout, fits_status);
00138     if (hdutype != IMAGE_HDU)
00139       PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid fits header");
00140     
00141     // Get image size.
00142     fits_get_img_dim(fptr, &naxis, &fits_status);
00143     fits_get_img_size(fptr, naxis, naxes, &fits_status);
00144     fits_report_error(stdout, fits_status);
00145     if (naxis < 2)
00146       PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid fits image size");
00147     if ((naxis >= 3)&&(naxes[2] != 1))
00148       PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid fits image size");
00149 
00150     
00151     // Allocate space for image.
00152     img->nx = (int)naxes[0];
00153     img->ny = (int)naxes[1];
00154     img->fov_x = 0.0;
00155     img->fov_y = 0.0;
00156     img->pix = (double*)malloc(img->nx * img->ny * sizeof(double));
00157     PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(img->pix);
00158     
00159     
00160     // Read image.
00161     fits_get_img_type(fptr, &bitpix, &fits_status);
00162     if (bitpix != DOUBLE_IMG && bitpix != FLOAT_IMG) 
00163       PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Fits image does not contain doubles");
00164     fpixel[0] = 1;
00165     fpixel[1] = 1;
00166     fpixel[2] = 1;
00167     fpixel[3] = 1;
00168     fits_read_pix(fptr, TDOUBLE, fpixel, naxes[0]*naxes[1], 
00169       NULL, img->pix, &anynul, &fits_status);
00170     fits_report_error(stdout, fits_status);
00171 
00172     // Close fits file.
00173     fits_close_file(fptr,  &fits_status);
00174     fits_report_error(stdout, fits_status);
00175 
00176     break;
00177 
00178   default:
00179     sprintf(buffer, 
00180             "Image filetype with id %d is not supported", 
00181             filetype);
00182     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC(buffer);
00183     break;
00184     
00185   }
00186 
00187   return 0;
00188 
00189 }

00202 int purify_image_writefile(purify_image *img,
00203                            const char *filename,
00204                            purify_image_filetype filetype) {
00205 
00206   char buffer[PURIFY_STRLEN];
00207   fitsfile *fptr;
00208   int fits_status = 0;
00209   long naxes[2], fpixel[2];
00210 
00211 
00212   switch (filetype) {
00213   case PURIFY_IMAGE_FILETYPE_FITS:
00214 
00215     // Open fits file.
00216     fits_create_file(&fptr, filename, &fits_status);
00217     fits_report_error(stdout, fits_status);
00218 
00219     // Create primary header.
00220     naxes[0] = img->nx;
00221     naxes[1] = img->ny;
00222     fits_create_img(fptr, DOUBLE_IMG, 2, naxes, &fits_status);
00223     fits_report_error(stdout, fits_status);
00224     fits_write_comment(fptr, "--------------------------------------------",  &fits_status);
00225     fits_write_comment(fptr, "File written by PURIFY (www.jasonmcewen.org)",  &fits_status);
00226     fits_write_comment(fptr, "--------------------------------------------",  &fits_status);
00227 
00228     // Write image.
00229     fpixel[0] = 1;
00230     fpixel[1] = 1;
00231     fits_write_pix(fptr, TDOUBLE, fpixel, naxes[0]*naxes[1], img->pix, &fits_status);
00232 
00233     // Close fits file.
00234     fits_close_file(fptr,  &fits_status);
00235     fits_report_error(stdout, fits_status);
00236 
00237     break;
00238 
00239   default:
00240     sprintf(buffer, 
00241             "Image filetype with id %d is not supported", 
00242             filetype);
00243     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC(buffer);
00244     break;
00245     
00246   }
00247 
00248   return 0;
00249 
00250 }
